author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump caused a political storm Monday by saying the deaths of director Rob Reiner and his wife were related to politics, calling them “reportedly” the result of “Trump derangement syndrome.”  The remark, made in a Truth Social post, drew notable shock and quick criticism from both sides of the aisle.  While Trump doesn’t often draw immediate blowback…
title: Trump shocks with Rob Reiner remarks

author: Al Weaver
description: The Senate on Monday cleared a key procedural hurdle as it looks to pass the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) before lawmakers leave town for the holidays at the end of the week.  Senators voted 76-20 to put the annual defense policy bill a step closer to final passage, which will still take several more…
title: Senate advances annual defense policy bill

author: Max Rego
description: A new Gallup poll found that the percentage of respondents using artificial intelligence (AI) at work ticked up during the third quarter of this year. The survey, released Sunday, found that 45 percent of U.S. employees reported using AI to complete tasks at work last quarter, up from 40 percent in quarter two. More than…
title: More people using AI at work: Gallup

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: President Trump said Monday his administration is “considering” reclassifying marijuana as a less dangerous drug, days after The Washington Post reported he is expected to sign an executive order telling agencies to pursue reclassification soon.  Such a move would continue efforts begun by the Biden administration, which started the process to make marijuana a Schedule III…
title: Trump says he is ‘considering’ marijuana reclassification

description: SPONSORED CONTENT Join The Hill’s and NewsNation’s Lindsey Granger for the adventure of a lifetime on “Destination Qatar,” exploring the world-class attractions, adventures, food, sports, and people that have turned the desert kingdom into the fastest-growing travel destination in the world. This program is sponsored by Visit Qatar on behalf of the State of Qatar.
title: Destination Qatar

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: An agreement between moderate Republicans and GOP leadership in the House to allow a vote on extending expiring Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies is on the rocks as the two sides squabble over the contents of the amendment. Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick (R-Pa.) and other GOP centrists are planning to introduce an amendment in the House…
title: Amendment to extend ObamaCare subsidies hits roadblock

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday lashed out at Colorado Gov. Jared Polis (D) over Tina Peters, his latest remarks focusing on the case of the state election official who was convicted of multiple felonies after breaching voting equipment in the 2020 election. Trump held an event in the Oval Office focused on slowing the flow of…
title: Trump rips ‘pathetic’ Colorado governor over Tina Peters case

author: Max Rego
description: An NBC News Decision Desk survey released Sunday found that over eight in 10 respondents are satisfied with their health insurance coverage, just weeks before Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies are set to expire. The poll, powered by SurveyMonkey, found that 34 percent of respondents were “very satisfied” with their coverage, while 48 percent reported…
title: 82 percent say they’re satisfied with health care coverage: Survey

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump dug in on his comments criticizing director Rob Reiner following his death over the weekend, telling reporters in the Oval Office he thought Reiner was “very bad for our country.”  “I wasn’t a fan of his at all. He was a deranged person as far as Trump is concerned,” Trump told reporters, before…
title: Trump digs in on Reiner comments, says director was ‘bad’ for country

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday signed an executive order to designate fentanyl as a “weapon of mass destruction,” dramatically escalating his fight against the drug. Trump hosted an event in the Oval Office to award the Mexican Border Defense Medal to members of the military who were dispatched to assist with efforts to crackdown on crossings…
title: Trump signs order labeling fentanyl ‘weapon of mass destruction’

author: Amie Parnes
description: Adam Parkhomenko, a longtime Democratic operative, met legendary director Rob Reiner the way much of Washington and Hollywood interacts these days: online.  It was the dark days of the pandemic in the summer of 2020, and Parkhomenko, who at the time was putting out a slew of anti-Republican ads on what was then Twitter, got…
title: Reiner left a mark with Democrats, who are stunned by his killing

author: Ella Lee
description: Hunter Biden was disbarred in Connecticut on Monday after facing complaints about his convictions on gun and tax charges, for which his father, former President Biden, later pardoned him. The former president’s son consented to being disbarred and admitted to attorney misconduct as part of an agreement with the state’s lawyer discipline office but did…
title: Hunter Biden disbarred in Connecticut after gun, tax conviction complaints

author: Julia Manchester
description: North Carolina Senate candidate and former Republican National Committee Chair Michael Whatley announced Monday that President Trump will visit the battleground state of North Carolina on Friday.  “I’m excited to welcome President @realDonaldTrump to Rocky Mount this Friday,” Whatley wrote in a post on the social platform X. “Let’s give him the North Carolina welcome…
title: Trump to visit North Carolina on Friday

author: Max Rego
description: The House Oversight and Government Reform Committee alleged that the Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) of Washington, D.C., under the leadership of outgoing Chief Police Pamela Smith, manipulated crime statistics.  The new report, released Sunday, accuses Smith of pressuring department employees into falsely reducing crime classifications to intermediate offenses in order to lower the number of…
title: Comer alleges outgoing DC police chief manipulated crime statistics

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Several Republican lawmakers publicly rebuked President Trump on Monday for suggesting acclaimed actor and director Rob Reiner was killed alongside his wife, Michele, this weekend because of Reiner’s disdain for the president — what Trump terms “Trump derangement syndrome.” The GOP blowback came largely from swing-district members, as well as from Republicans who have previously…
title: Trump’s post on Rob Reiner draws blowback from Republicans

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Nine Jewish members of the Senate Democratic Caucus expressed horror over Sunday’s killings at a Hanukkah event at Bondi Beach in Australia, where at least 15 people were killed by two shooters.   “We are horrified by the brutality of this attack, which comes at a time when Australia has seen a terrible rise in…
title: Senators express horror at antisemitic Hanukkah attack in Australia

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Cable news channel NewsNation has hired political analyst and commentator Katie Pavlich to host a show during the channel’s 10 p.m. hour, the network announced Monday. Pavlich, formerly a political contributor and analyst for the Fox News Channel, will begin her hosting duties for NewsNation in 2026 and fill the time slot previously occupied by…
title: NewsNation hires Katie Pavlich as prime-time host

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: The Army announced Monday the names of the two Iowa National Guard members killed in an Islamic State ambush in Syria over the weekend. Sgt. Edgar Brian Torres Tovar, 25, of Des Moines, and Sgt. William Nathaniel Howard, 29, of Marshalltown, died Saturday in Palmyra, Syria, “of injuries sustained while engaged with hostile forces,” according to an…
title: Iowa National Guard members identified as 2 killed in Syria

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former New York City Police Department Deputy Commissioner John Miller said he sees “friction” between local police and the FBI over the handling of the “person of interest” in the Brown University shooting who was subsequently released because of insufficient evidence. In an interview on “CNN Newsroom” late Sunday, Miller said he noticed “a couple…
title: Former NYPD leader sees ‘friction’ between FBI, Providence police over ‘person of interest’ in Brown shooting

author: Julia Manchester
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) said on Monday that his state has the right to regulate artificial intelligence (AI) despite President Trump’s executive order last week that seeks to institute a national AI standard by pushing back on state laws.  DeSantis noted that the executive order does not block Florida or other states from instituting…
title: DeSantis: Florida has ‘right’ to regulate AI rules despite Trump’s order

author: Filip Timotija
description: Trinidad and Tobago’s government announced on Monday that it would open up its airports to U.S. military aircraft in the coming weeks as tensions between Venezuela and the U.S. escalate.  Trinidad and Tobago’s foreign ministry said it has “granted approvals” to U.S. military jets to transit the country’s airports, adding that the U.S. has advised…
title: Trinidad and Tobago opening airports to US military flights amid Venezuela tensions

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.) said her son, a U.S.-born citizen, was targeted by ICE agents on Saturday after he stopped at a Target store. She said her son was pulled over but then was allowed to move on after he provided his passport.  “Yesterday after he made a stop at Target, he did get pulled…
title: Omar says son targeted by ICE in traffic stop

author: Kyle Balluck
description: President Trump on Monday afternoon is scheduled to participate in a Mexican Border Defense Medal presentation. The medal was established to recognize service members deployed to the U.S. international border with Mexico. Watch the presentation, scheduled to begin at 3 p.m. EST, in the player above.
title: Watch live: Trump participates in medal presentation

author: Joseph Choi
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) announced Monday he is hiring two former top officials from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) who were pushed out by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. or resigned in protest of his policies. Susan Monarez, former CDC director, and Deb Houry, former CDC chief…
title: Newsom hires former CDC leaders as public health advisers

author: Sean Spicer, opinion contributor
description: President Trump's national security trade actions are delivering real results, as evidenced by increased investment in the U.S., new jobs, and stronger local economies, due to tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.
title: Trump’s steel and aluminum tariffs are putting America first

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Progressive former Waltham City Councilor Jonathan Paz announced Monday that he’s challenging House Democratic Whip Katherine Clark (D-Mass.) for her seat.  “I’m challenging one of the most powerful Democrats in the House, because we need new leadership,” Paz said in a roughly two-minute ad. “Let’s just call it what it is: Our Democratic leaders are failing us.”  Paz founded two organizations supporting…
title: Katherine Clark, No. 2 House Democrat, gets progressive primary challenger

author: Brooke L. Rollins, opinion contributor
description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture has approved waivers for six states to restrict the purchase of junk food and sweetened beverages with SNAP benefits, in an effort to promote healthier eating habits and reduce the chronic disease epidemic.
title: The Trump administration is partnering with governors to Make America Healthy Again

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: Vaccines didn’t change. The virus didn’t change. What changed was the volume given to fear over facts, and the cost of that choice is now being measured in hospital beds, quarantines and children’s lives.
title: Measles cases surging as US approaches ’embarrassing’ milestone

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) rebuked President Trump on Monday for suggesting acclaimed actor and director Rob Reiner was killed this weekend because of his political opposition to the president — what Trump calls “Trump Derangement Syndrome.” In a post on the social platform X, Greene pushed back on Trump’s statement, calling the deaths of…
title: Greene criticizes Trump over Rob Reiner Trump derangement post

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: No more dead American soldiers overseas — that should be our mission and our mantra.
title: ISIS kills 2 US soldiers in Syria — why were we there at all?

author: Harlan Ullman, opinion contributor
description: The great tune “Rule Britannia” once had meaning with this refrain: “Rule Britannia, Britain rules the waves.”
title: What can Britannia rule anymore?

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) slammed President Trump on the social platform X on Monday after he made remarks about recently deceased Hollywood director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele.  “Regardless of how you felt about Rob Reiner, this is inappropriate and disrespectful discourse about a man who was just brutally murdered. I guess my elected…
title: Massie blasts Trump’s ‘disrespectful’ Reiner post: ‘I challenge anyone to defend it’

author: Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto (D-Nev.), opinion contributor
description: Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto is working on legislation to strengthen the U.S. critical mineral supply chain and reduce reliance on China, by creating a tax credit for American companies that process rare earth minerals and establishing a Critical Minerals Security Alliance with global trading partners.
title: Trump’s chaos is ceding the critical mineral space to China

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: A JetBlue pilot said a “midair collision” was avoided in an incident near Venezuela that the commercial pilot is blaming on the pilot of a U.S. Air Force refueling tanker.  “We almost had a midair collision up here,” the JetBlue pilot said, according to a recording of his conversation with air traffic control obtained by…
title: JetBlue flight avoids ‘midair collision’ with US Air Force tanker near Venezuela

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Attorney General Pam Bondi said U.S. officials foiled a planned terror attack in Los Angeles, arresting four people allegedly plotting to launch a series of bombings on New Year’s Eve. Bondi and FBI Director Kash Patel said they arrested members of the “Turtle Island Liberation Front,” describing it as a pro-Palestinian extremist group. “After an…
title: Terror plot targeting California disrupted, 4 arrested: Bondi

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is planning to enact stricter gun laws after a shooting at a Hanukkah event that left at least 16 people dead on Sunday.  “What we saw yesterday was an act of pure evil, an act of antisemitism, an act of terrorism on our shores in an iconic Australian location, Bondi…
title: Australia planning tougher gun laws after deadly Hanukkah attack

author: John Kenneth White, opinion contributor
description: While most Americans see themselves as good, decent and honest, there are signs those qualities are disappearing.
title: Are we good and decent people?

author: James Durso, opinion contributor
description: In 2024 alone, ENISA, the European Union Agency for Cybersecurity, logged more than 11,000 serious cyber incidents across the European Union.
title: Russia’s hidden assault on Europe

author: Tony Kurzweil
description: Nick Reiner is now being held on a $4 million bail.
title: Nick Reiner arrested after parents Rob and Michele found dead in Los Angeles area home

author: The Associated Press
description: As the sounds of bullets rang out and the bodies fell, the young mother threw herself on top of her 5-year-old son and prayed.
title: ‘I’m dying. I can’t breathe’: Scenes of death, fear and chaos follow Bondi Beach shooting

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: More than 30,000 Spotify users reported issues with the streaming-music service on Monday morning, according to outage reports compiled by DownDetector.
title: Spotify says service restored after 30,000 users report outages

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump weighed in on the apparent homicide of director Rob Reiner and his wife in a TruthSocial post on Monday, suggesting the cause of death was reportedly “Trump derangement syndrome.” “A very sad thing happened last night in Hollywood. Rob Reiner, a tortured and struggling, but once very talented movie director and comedy star,…
title: Trump says Rob Reiner, victims of possible homicide, died of ‘Trump derangement syndrome’

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: There are connections between Trump’s buffoonery and the threats he poses to our freedom and future.
title: Trump’s absurdities are a prelude to his atrocities

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Fewer self-identifying MAGA Republicans said in a new poll that they “strongly” approve of the job President Trump is doing in office, even as his support from the group remains high. In the NBC News survey, released Sunday, 70 percent of respondents who consider themselves MAGA Republicans said they strongly approve of the president’s job…
title: Fewer MAGA Republicans ‘strongly’ support Trump: Poll

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The New York Times editorial board blasted President Trump over his administration’s handling of military issues and foreign policy in a piece published on Sunday. In the editorial, the Times wrote that under Trump, “well-established rules of engagement have yielded to blowing up small boats on the high seas. In place of standing with Ukraine’s…
title: NY Times on Trump’s ‘inadequate’ defense strategy: He ‘believes in cutting deals, not sharing values’

author: The Hill Staff
description: The House and Senate return to Washington for the last week before the long holiday recess, and the expiring Affordable Care Act subsidies will take center stage once again. The House is expected to vote on the Republicans’ health care proposal, as well as an ObamaCare subsidies extension amendment. The Senate will take up the…
title: Live updates: House turns to health care while Senate looks to lock down defense spending

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: Social media platforms are being used to inject toxic nonsense into American political discourse, and foreign governments are engaging in daily U.S. influencing efforts to amp political division, making it difficult to have an honest election in 2026 or 2028.
title: Protect children and US democracy from malign tech influence

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Erika Kirk, widow of the late conservative activist Charlie Kirk, said she plans to meet with right-wing podcast host Candance Owens on Monday. “Candace Owens and I are meeting for a private, in-person discussion on Monday, December 15,” Kirk wrote on the social platform X late Sunday. “@RealCandaceO and I have agreed that public discussions,…
title: Erika Kirk to meet privately with conservative podcaster Candace Owens

author: Kareem Rifai, opinion contributor
description: Trump is sending a dangerous message to Beijing: trade with China comes before anything else, including America’s security commitments to its allies.
title: Japan needs tariff relief now — what is Trump waiting for?

author: Douglas Schoen and Carly Cooperman, opinion contributor
description: Trump figures to close the year with a steady erosion in his poll numbers, many of which are now at the lowest point in either of his terms.
title: Polls: Trump is ending 2025 on a downward spiral

author: William S. Becker, opinion contributor
description: It is time — actually, well past time — for members of Congress to hitch up their Big Boy and Girl pants, red as well as blue, to do something about this.
title: Trump is the world’s most dangerous man

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Leading Democrats mourned the loss of acclaimed actor and director Rob Reiner, a longtime advocate for liberal causes, who was found dead alongside his wife Michele in their home in Los Angeles on Sunday. The national figures noted Reiner’s lifelong contributions to film but said his contributions extended far beyond Hollywood. Former President Obama said…
title: Top Democrats ‘heartbroken’ by deaths of Reiner, wife

author: Terry Schilling and Brian Robertson, opinion contributors
description: The American Dream of ever-rising prospects for the next generation is in grave danger.
title: Republicans need an affordable family formation agenda

author: Sophia Szabo
description: "It felt like there was a ghost," Manns said of returning to his dorm room Sunday.
title: Brown student says roommate was killed in campus shooting: ‘It doesn’t feel real’

author: Marc Sternfield
description: Rob Reiner, the director behind some of the most beloved classics of the 20th century, was found dead along with his wife inside their Brentwood, California, home on Sunday -- both the apparent victims of a homicide, according to police.
title: Remembering actor and filmmaker Rob Reiner, dead at 78

author: Tanya Nguyen
description: The son of Texas A&M University's campus rabbi is among those critically wounded in a mass shooting Sunday at a Hanukkah celebration in Sydney, Australia.
title: Texas A&M rabbi’s son wounded in Sydney Hanukkah shooting

author: Becket Adams, opinion contributor
description: We live in a world where awards named after our most famous journalists are given to actual clowns.
title: With pro-journalism groups like these, who needs critics?

author: Mike Lillis
description: House Democrats say they’re lining up to support a bipartisan extension of enhanced ObamaCare subsidies — if they get a green light from party leaders. Supporters of two bipartisan proposals to extend the Affordable Care Act (ACA) tax credits, which are set to expire on Dec. 31, have launched discharge petitions to force votes on…
title: Democrats say they need leadership green light to back GOP bills to extend ACA tax credits

author: Julia Mueller
description: A growing number of Muslim candidates are seeking office following Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s stunning success in New York City last month. Last week, an Arab and Muslim American co-founder of the “Uncommitted” movement, which urged Democrats to cast 2024 protest votes over the Israel-Hamas war, launched a bid for state office in Michigan. And this…
title: More Muslim candidates seek office as ‘Mamdani effect’ takes hold

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senators in both parties are bracing for another government shutdown next year after Republicans blocked a proposal to extend expiring health insurance subsidies, the issue that triggered the 43-day closure that consumed much of the fall calendar. Liberal Democrats in the Senate are fuming that Republicans blocked a proposal to extend the subsidies, which are…
title: Senators brace for another possible shutdown in January

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: A string of scandals involving illegal gambling and alleged game rigging in pro sports is getting the attention of lawmakers on Capitol Hill, with some arguing Congress should have a greater role in shoring up the integrity of games and regulating sports betting.   The Senate Commerce Committee, chaired by Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Texas), was…
title: Senators fear sports gambling is getting out of control, raise regulation

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: Republicans are staring down a major health care challenge as Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies are set to expire at the end of the month. With a two-week recess beginning Dec. 22, they only have this week to get the issue resolved. Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) is aiming to bring a partisan GOP health care package…
title: The Week Ahead: Republicans face a health care dilemma

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Florida will be hit harder than any other state if ObamaCare subsidies expire at the end of the year, which is looking increasingly likely as Republicans in Congress struggle to unite behind a plan to extend the tax credits.  More than 1.5 million Floridians could lose healthcare as monthly payments skyrocket. Average premium costs could…
title: Why Florida is ground zero for coming ObamaCare storm

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Editors note: The Hill has updated this story, published Sunday, that named a person of interest in the Brown University shooting. Authorities late Sunday determined he would be released. Police said Sunday night they plan to release a person of interest detained in connection to the Brown University shooting over the weekend, a major setback…
title: Authorities release reported person of interest in Brown University shooting

author: Tara Suter
description: A person of interest has been identified following a shooting Saturday at Brown University that least two dead and nine others wounded, according to officials. The shooting has drawn sympathies from prominent figures, including President Trump, Vice President Vance and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.). The person of interest was detained overnight, Providence, R.I.,…
title: Who is Benjamin Erickson, reported person of interest in Brown University shooting?

author: Max Rego
description: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.) called on Congress to pass legislation addressing expiring subsidies offered under the Affordable Care Act (ACA), regardless of who gets the credit. “Good policy is good politics,” Cassidy told host Chris Stirewalt on NewsNation’s “The Hill Sunday.” “Let’s not have a Republican plan or a Democratic plan, let’s have an American…
title: Cassidy says ‘I don’t care who gets the credit’ on ACA subsidies extension

description: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.) called on Congress to pass legislation addressing expiring subsidies offered under the Affordable Care Act (ACA), regardless of who gets the credit. “Good policy is good politics,” Cassidy told host Chris Stirewalt on NewsNation’s “The Hill Sunday.” “Let’s not have a Republican plan or a Democratic plan, let’s have an American…
title: Cassidy says ‘I don’t care who gets the credit’ on ACA subsidies extension
